data.title: Watch task indicator

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
One more request that would go great with: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8509
Ability to see that there is active watch task running.
Maybe in the footer here: 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/16456456/e7979cf6-3de5-11e6-94f0-f6a1edcf341b.png)

data.title: Selection color uses different blue in list compared to tree
Expose ActivityBar as part of Extensions api
data.body:
Currently I don't believe there is anyway in an extension to add an item to the activity bar and set the viewlets it will load etc...

Make an api available 
e.g. 
`vscode.workbench.ActivityBar.addItem(ActivityBarItem: item)`

Also a way of opening to a ActivityBarItem inside of a command(on context menu item click command)
e.g. 

```
vscode.workbench.ActivityBar.getItem(string: name) : ActivityBarItem
vscode.workbench.ActivityBar.focusedItem : ActivityBarItem
vscode.workbench.ActivityBar.focusItem(string: name)
vscode.workbench.ActivityBar.focusItem(ActivityBarItem: activityBarItem)
```

data.title: Tasks: [OSX] Task no longer executes in correct user environment
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insiders June 28th 2016.
- OS Version: Capitan 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Define a task that executes a shell script. In this shell script invoke an `npm` command
2. Result: `./build.sh: line 2: npm: command not found`

This works fine in VSCode v. 1.2.1

data.title: missing command error only shows on console
data.body:
- Configure a menu item with an invalid command id in the editor title

```
"editor/title": [
                {
                    "command": "v.sayHello",
                    "alt": "v.sayHello2",
                    "group": "navigation",
                    "when": "resourceLangId == typescript"
                }
            ]
```
- select the menu item
  üêõ the error shows on the console only

data.title: Change all occurrences changes from import statement too
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windown 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a TS file
2. make a variable as `private core;`
3. right click and select change all occurrences
4. change the name of variable to core1
5. `import {Component} from "angular2/core";` will be changed to `import {Component} from "angular2/core2";`

data.title: Intergrated Terminal not showing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.3.0-insider (798b41ab1cf3636a27042020a54ddfb4cfb8d23c, 2016-06-29T05:07:11.483Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Visual Studio Code
2. Go to View-> Integrated Terminal
3. Terminal shows for about 1 milisecond and then it disappears.

I've tried also with the other methods for showing it with no success (Command Pallette, Shortcut)
I've also tried to change from cmd.exe to powershell. Same results

data.title: Cannot open tab's context menu (e.g. go to next diff) with keyboard
data.body:
Testing #7854

I tried moving focus to a tab and pressing shift-f10. 

You need to listen for Shift+F10 and bring up the context menu (e.g. tree widget also does it.)

data.title: Not sure I understand the need for two settings for workbench.editor.enablePreview
data.body:
Testing #7854 

Why is there a special setting `workbench.editor.enablePreviewFromQuickOpen` ?

AFAIK editors can be opened via ctrl+click to go to definition, via ctrl+click to follow a link, from the extension host, etc.

Do you plan to add a config key for each of those? If not, why the special `workbench.editor.enablePreviewFromQuickOpen`

data.title: Output test files don't delete/rename themselves after doing the same operation in src files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10
  
  I am building a VS Code extension, and on writing test cases for it, I noticed that files in _out/test_ get created automatically upon creation in _/test_ but don't get renamed or deleted.
  **Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Start Yo Code and scaffold a TS extension [(Yo code)](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensions/example-hello-world)
2. open the extension in VS Code and build once to get typescript compiler running on watch mode (need to select "Launch Extension" from debug pane)
3. go to _/test_ and create _main.test.ts_. See that the file is generated in _out/test_ folder.
4. Delete (or rename) _main.test.ts_ . 
5. In _/out/test_ , you will see that the old files are still there.

data.title: Perform search when hitting ENTER key in search detail fields
data.body:
Frequently, when performing a global search for some code, I find myself having to narrow down the search to files of a specific type (*.js, *.scss etc).

I pop open the "search details" section and add a pattern to match the files. 
Then I hit ENTER but nothing happens. :sob: 

It would be great to initiate a search when hitting ENTER in either the "files to include" or "files to exclude" section.

Alternatively, pressing SHIFT + TAB to return to the search box and then hitting ENTER could work as well. 
Currently, I have to press SHIFT + TAB five times to get back to the search box.

data.title: Build errors have been detected during preLaunchTask 'npm'

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5

If I run my extension in debug mode the first time it's all fine. But when re-running I get the error message `Build errors have been detected during preLaunchTask 'npm'`. I can click "Debug Anyway", though (and it works).

After a restart of vscode I can run my extension without error once again before the error occurs again.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create an empty TypeScript extension with Yeoman
2. Install typings: `typings install registry:env/meteor --global`

I also created a repository including the 2 steps, if you prefer that way: https://github.com/vuhrmeister/vscode-extension-prelaunch-fail

I opened this issue as requested by @isidorn (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4070#issuecomment-229321428).

data.title: Symbol quick open: filter for Cmd+P, relax for Cmd+T
data.body: Should also document this in the quick open help and commands.

data.title: Invalid uri. Scheme and authority or path must be set.
data.body: Seeing these error when markdown is involved: `shell.js:248 Invalid uri. Scheme and authority or path must be set.` It seems that we try to open an empty uri.

data.title: No user message when Markdown styling sheet can not be found
data.body:
Testing #7945
- in the user setttings add `"markdown.styles": ["./mdstyles1.css"]`
  if mdstyles1.css does not exist in the workspace there's no warning, neither in the user settings nor
  when looking at a preview.
  The dev tools console has an entry, but that's not where users should look.

I guess the best would be to warn when opening the preview.

data.title: Open File Command take parameters
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-Insiders
- OS Version: OSX

We expose `workbench.action.files.openFile` for users to open file but seems it doesn't take any parameter or is it just me failing to figure it out from documentation? Open files in Tabs/Windows through API would be perfect IMHO.

BTW, @bpasero mentioned kindly in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/5437 that we need to use `workbench.action.files.openFileFolder` but it's not updated in our documentation https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/customization/keybindings#_file-management which might bothers our users.

data.title: Why does monaco-editor support IE9 and IE10?
data.body:
Refs: #8229

Why does monaco-editor support IE9 and IE10, looking at the [issues](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/labels/monaco-editor) we found during this endgame I do not think there are users that use our editor or IE9 or IE10 (otherwise they would complain).

ping @alexandrudima @egamma
